C.)
More Than A Million People Every Week Show Suicidal Intent When Chatting With ChatGPT, OpenAI Estimates
| TheGuardian.com | October 27, 2025
OpenAI reports that over a million ChatGPT users express potential suicidal intent weekly. In a recent evaluation, they noted around 560,000 users may show signs of serious mental health emergencies. This comes amidst growing scrutiny of AI‚Äôs impact on mental health and ongoing investigations into AI chatbot safety.
D.)
Sora Is Showing Us How Broken Deepfake Detection Is
| TheVerge.com | October 27, 2025
OpenAI‚Äôs new deepfake machine, Sora, illustrates weaknesses in AI labeling systems, including the C2PA authentication initiative. Despite incorporating metadata that aims to identify AI-generated content, there is minimal visibility for users on platforms like TikTok and YouTube, raising concerns over misinformation and the efficacy of current deepfake detection methods.
E.)
AI PC Buyer‚Äôs Guide: Specs That Actually Matter (ft. Dell‚Äôs Logan Lawler)
| The Neuron | YouTube.com | October 24, 2025
Logan Lawler from Dell Technologies provides critical insights on what defines an ‚ÄúAI PC,‚Äù distilling essential specifications such as CPUs, GPUs, memory, and NPUs. This guide is invaluable for developers, researchers, and AI enthusiasts seeking to make informed hardware choices for their machine learning and local AI projects.

AI search startup Perplexity has signed a multi-year licensing deal with Getty Images, which gives it permission to display images from Getty across its AI-powered search and discovery tools. The deal marks a notable shift for the company, which has been hit by allegations of content scraping and plagiarism, and signals an effort to establish more formal content partnerships.

28.)
Adobe Unveils Experimental AI Tool That Edits Entire Videos From A Single Frame
| TheVerge.com | October 31, 2025
Adobe demonstrated some of the experimental AI tools it‚Äôs working on at its Max conference that provide new ways to intuitively edit photos, videos, and audio. These experiments, called ‚Äúsneaks,‚Äù include tools that instantly apply any changes you make to one frame across an entire video, easily manipulate light in images, and correct mispronunciations in audio recordings.
29.)
Comet Launches Privacy Snapshot Feature To Enhance Security In Its AI-Powered Browser
| Perplexity.ai | October 31, 2025
Comet is the world‚Äôs first browser built from the ground up to be an AI assistant. Knowing we were building one of the first AI browsers and powerful personal assistants, we designed Comet to have privacy and security at the core.

Research: Meta‚Äôs Circuit-Based Reasoning Verification Reveals And Fixes AI Flaws In Real Time, Making Models More Transparent And Reliable.
| VentureBeat.com | October 31, 2025
Researchers at Meta FAIR and the University of Edinburgh have developed a new technique that can predict the correctness of a large language model‚Äôs (LLM) reasoning and even intervene to fix its mistakes. Called Circuit-based Reasoning Verification (CRV), the method looks inside an LLM to monitor its internal ‚Äúreasoning circuits‚Äù and detect signs of computational errors as the model solves a problem.

These models are fine-tuned versions of our gpt-oss open models and available under the same permissive Apache 2.0 license, allowing anyone to use, modify, and deploy them freely.
